title: What do far-right parties do for the climate when they are in power?
summary: Climate is generally not a priority for such parties. In France, the subject is virtually absent from the Rassemblement National's policy platform.

title: French elections: Why will cohabitation be the likely winner (and what the hell does it mean?)
summary: In his first column for Le Monde in English on the upcoming snap elections, Le Monde's Gilles Paris looks at the previous dissolutions and the impact they had on the way France was governed.

title: French elections: What's in the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance's policy platform?
summary: Purchasing power, pensions and growth: The left-wing union is back on familiar turf – that of a left-right confrontation. It intends to deliver a social message to a France that is 'weakened' by seven years of liberalism.

title: War in Ukraine: The French far right's quest to appear respectable
summary: Jordan Bardella's statement on Wednesday that Ukraine should 'be able to defend itself' represents a continued effort to soften the Rassemblement National's position on an issue that remains embarrassing for the far-right party.

title: Euro 2024: Mbappé on sub bench for France's 0-0 game against the Netherlands
summary: It leaves both teams on four points in Group D after their second match. Poland, who lost 3-1 to Austria in Berlin earlier Friday, became the first team dumped out despite Lewandowski's return from an injury.

title: 22 killed in shelling near Red Cross Gaza office, says ICRC
summary: An Israeli Defense Force spokesman did not acknowledge any role in the incident, Friday, but said it was 'under review.'

title: The French army works on the finishing touches of its reorganization in Africa
summary: France's military presence could be significantly reduced at its bases on the continent, notably in Côte d'Ivoire, Gabon, Senegal, and Chad.

title: Orano in Niger: The junta has deprived the French multinational of one of its largest uranium deposits
summary: The military regime has decided to withdraw the company's license for future operations at the Imouraren uranium mine in the northeast of the country.

title: Ukraine and Gaza: Highlights of Karim Khan's term at the helm of the ICC
summary: Judges of the International Criminal Court are expected to rule shortly on the arrest warrants requested by the prosecutor against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his Defense Minister and three Hamas leaders. This case will have a significant impact on the prosecutor's record, whose performance to date has been mixed.

title: At least 6 heat-related deaths in Phoenix area
summary: Sizzling conditions on Friday were also expected in parts of Ohio and Indiana, where heat indexes were likely to soar past 100° Fahrenheit.

title: In Doha, Gaza survivors slowly come back to life
summary: Since the start of the war in Gaza, almost 800 Palestinians wounded in Israeli bombardments have been treated in Qatar. These survivors bear scars, many are amputees and all are consumed with anxiety for loved ones left behind.

title: The Northern California dams sowing discord
summary: Efforts to dismantle hydroelectric dams on the Klamath, the river that runs through the region, are provoking the anger of local residents who feel that the environmental goals advanced by officials go against their interests.

title: Paris 2024: New tests show Seine water too dirty for swimming events
summary: According to a report published by the Paris region and mayor's office, analysis shows the water does 'not meet the standards' set for the 2024 Olympic Games' open-water events, citing the presence of two kinds of fecal bacteria, including E. Coli.

title: Teamsters Union president will speak at the US Republican National Convention
summary: Donald Trump is angling to chip away at President Joe Biden's support among the blue-collar workers who are expected to play a major role in the 2024 general election.

title: Mecca sees over 1,000 deaths during the Hajj, a pilgrimage threatened by climate change
summary: Temperatures topped 50°C as over 1.8 million Muslims from some 20 countries flocked to Saudi Arabia's holy city from June 14 to 19.

title: Paris 2024: New material to combat voyeurism in women's sport
summary: A Japanese manufacturer has developed a material that blocks infrared photography which reveals underwear or lines of the body, producing images that are circulated on pornographic websites.

title: Macron's short-term strategy: Attacking the left before dealing with the far right
summary: The French president has been drawing on the vocabulary of the far right to attack the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance, at the risk of compromising the chances of uniting to beat the far-right Rassemblement National in run-off elections.

title: In Norrköping, Sweden gives 'security zones' a try
summary: From June 5 to 19, police officers were allowed to search residents and their vehicles, without a warrant or probable cause. This measure is part of the repressive plan carried out by the liberal-conservative coalition, which governs with the far right.

title: UK election: On the road in a broken nation
summary: Like France, the UK is about to vote in early general elections. Before leaving England, where he has lived for two decades, Le Monde journalist Eric Albert took one last trip across the country. From Hartlepool, where life expectancy is falling, to Hastings, where fishermen have had to put away their nets, he paints a portrait of a broken nation.

title: In the North Sea, Russia conceals espionage activities with commercial ships
summary: Dozens of tankers, cargo ships, fishing boats, and cruise ships are suspected of circling strategic infrastructure to gather information for Moscow.

title: A revolution in the treatment of obesity
summary: Molecules that mimic digestive hormones and act on satiety are revolutionizing the treatment of obese patients. French health authorities have been slow to approve their marketing, while, elsewhere, there is a rush to buy them, even though their long-term effects remain unknown.
